description: Companion tutorial scripts - triggered once per event

messages.text: Hey there! Welcome to the world! I'm your companion, and I'll help you survive out here.
Press 'E' to open your backpack anytime. That's where you'll store everything you collect!
See that machete in your hotbar? Uncle Beastly left it for you. Select it and hold left-click on trees to chop wood!
That's Uncle Beastly's machete! Hold left-click on trees, grass, dirt, or stone to harvest them.
It never dulls, so chop away! You'll need lots of wood to craft things at the Workbench.
This is your backpack! It has tons of space for storing materials, food, and tools.
Drag items between your hotbar and backpack to organize. Keep your most-used items in the hotbar for quick access!
Great job finding the backpack! Press M to open your World Map, or press C to open the Companion Codex where you can view your companions and set your active battle partner!

Oh, and see that sun icon in the top-left? That shows the time of day - the image changes as time passes! Click on it to open the Explorer's Menu where you can save your game, adjust settings, and more.
Nice! You crafted a Workbench! This is where you'll craft basic tools and structures.
Place it down by selecting it in your hotbar and right-clicking on the ground. Then right-click it again to open!
Perfect! Now right-click the Workbench to open it and see what you can craft.
Welcome to the Workbench! Here you can craft basic items like the Tool Bench, Kitchen Bench, torches, and campfires.
The left side shows recipes. Click a recipe to see what materials you need. If you have them, click 'Craft' to make it!
I'd recommend crafting a Tool Bench next - that's where the REAL magic happens! You'll be able to craft better tools there.
Excellent! The Tool Bench lets you craft advanced items like spears, light orbs, and upgraded tools!
Place it down near your Workbench to create a crafting station. Organization is key!
This is the Tool Bench! Here you can craft specialized tools and equipment.
Light Orbs are super useful - they glow permanently so you can see at night! Spears let you hunt animals from a distance.
Each blueprint shows the materials needed. Some items need materials from the Kitchen Bench too - it's all connected!
A Kitchen Bench! Now we're cooking! Literally!
This is where you'll turn raw meat into cooked food, and combine ingredients into better meals. Food restores health during combat!
Welcome to the Kitchen! This is where you cook food to restore health and stamina.
Hunt rabbits with spears to get raw meat, then cook it here. Cooked food is WAY better than raw!
You can also grow crops with the Hoe and Watering Can to make even better meals. Farming + hunting = survival!
You made a torch! These are temporary light sources - they glow for a while then burn out.
Place torches around your base to see at night. But if you want permanent light, craft Light Orbs at the Tool Bench!
A campfire! This is SUPER important - it's your respawn point!
Place it down where you want to respawn if you die. The game also auto-saves when you place a campfire, so use it often!
Smart move! That campfire is now your respawn point. If you die, you'll wake up right here!
The game also auto-saved just now. Place a new campfire anytime you want to update your respawn location.
You crafted a Hoe! Now you can start farming!
Right-click on grass or dirt with the hoe to till it into farmland. Then plant seeds and use the Watering Can to make crops grow!
Nice! The Watering Can waters your crops to help them grow faster.
Stand near water (like a pond) and right-click to fill it up. Then right-click on farmland to water your crops!
Awesome! Light Orbs are permanent light sources - they NEVER burn out!
Place them around your base, in caves, or along paths. They'll keep glowing forever, unlike torches!
You made a spear! This is your hunting weapon!
Hold right-click to charge up a throw, then release to launch it! Hit rabbits to hunt them for meat. Cook the meat at the Kitchen Bench!
Uh oh... it's getting dark. Ghosts come out at night, and they're NOT friendly!
Place torches or Light Orbs to see in the dark. And watch out - ghosts can hurt you, so keep your health up!
If you have a campfire, stay near it at night. It's safer there!
There's a ghost! Don't let it touch you - ghosts deal damage!
Some ghosts are angry and will chase you. Others just float around. Either way, keep your distance at night!
Look, a rabbit! They spawn at dawn and are pretty skittish.
If you have a spear, you can hunt them for meat. Charge up a throw with right-click, then release to throw!
